When mother Yuko (Hideo Hara) discovers that her reclusive son Koichi (Ryo Kase) has hanged himself in his room, she tries to cut the rope to save him but injures herself in the process of putting him down, causing her to lose consciousness.

His mother, Yuko (Hideko Hara), finds Koichi's body and she, in turn, is found unconscious, with irregular cuts on one arm, by her daughter, Fumi (Mai Kiryu).

Yuko Nakauchi, from Tokyo, saw the film Un Nos Ola' Leuad, or One Moonlit Night, on Japanese TV in 1993.

Yuko said she is finding it difficult to understand why the Japanese cannot love their own country and why they do not study their country's own history as much as people overseas do.
